con:method.name: POST A New Label to a Card

con:testSuite.name: Default Borad set up
con:testSuite.con:description: This TestSuite will Clear down the Board based upon the BoardID provided in the Project level custom property. It will delete all lists and then add back a selection of cards based upon the TestSuite level custom properties.

con:testCase.name: Clear the Board
con:testCase.con:description: Firstly this TestCase will get the listID, store this in a custom property A delete request will then be made based on this ID stored It will then get an updated list information from the board If there is another ID present it will loop the steps, if not it will move on.

con:testStep.name: Loop until all lists have been deleted

con:testCase.name: Add Backlog List & Cards
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will create a list and 4 card based upon the Custom Levels at TestSuite level

con:testCase.name: Add In Progress List & Cards
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will create a list and 2 card based upon the Custom Levels at TestSuite level

con:testCase.name: Add Blocked List & Cards
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will create a list and 1 card based upon the Custom Levels at TestSuite level

con:testCase.name: Add Done List & Cards
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will create a list and 2 card based upon the Custom Levels at TestSuite level

con:property.con:name: Backlog_Card3
con:property.con:value: Investigate importing all endpoints from Trello

con:property.con:name: Backlog_Card4
con:property.con:value: Add more tests to the SOAP UI Project

con:testSuite.name: New Card
con:testSuite.con:description: This TestSuite will Create a new card, add a label to it, move it to another list Add a comment and member then move the card one last time.

con:testCase.name: Create a New Card
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will get the list information and store the ID of the Backlog Board. It will use this ID when creating the card so it knows which list it should store the new card in.

con:testCase.name: Add a Label
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will get all labels, store the Blue label ID and then update that label with the name we want to give it. It will then add this label to the newly created card.

con:testStep.name: Add the Label to the Card

con:config.methodName: POST A New Label to a Card

con:restRequest.name: Add the Label to the Card

con:testCase.name: Move the Card
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will get and store the ID of the list called 'InProgress'. It will the update the new card and put it into the 'inProgress' list.

con:testCase.name: Add Comments to the Card
con:testCase.con:description: Simple POST To the new cardID with comments specified in the TestSuite level custom property.

con:testCase.name: Add A member to the Card
con:testCase.con:description: This TestSutie will GET all board members so we can store the memberID This will then POST that memberID to the CardID created.

con:testCase.name: Move the Card
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will get and store the ID of the list called 'InProgress'. It will the update the new card and put it into the 'inProgress' list.

con:testSuite.name: Another Card
con:testSuite.con:description: This TestSuite will add another card, embed a link to the first card made. Then add an attachment to a URL given.

con:testCase.name: Create another New Card
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will create another Card, but in a different way to how it was done in the first TestSuite. This will it uses a groovy script to create / update a property called "Card_Name". We also use Groovy to get the ID of the new card and store this at both Project and TestSuite level.

con:config.script: //Set the Project Level property called 'Card_Name' with a specific name testRunner.testCase.testSuite.project.setPropertyValue( "Card_Name", "New Card Via Groovy" )

con:testCase.name: Link back to the first card
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will transfer the Original CardID to the Project Level so it can be used by the Rest TestStep. It will then GET the information of that card and store the URL of it in a custom property.

con:testCase.name: Add Comments to the Card
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will then format a comment with the URL embedded in it and POST this to the new card.

con:testCase.name: Add Attachment
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will attach an image / file from the URL specified at TestSuite level.

con:property.con:name: InitialCard_Comment
con:property.con:value: I can link to another card link this, hi-

con:property.con:name: Card_Comment
con:property.con:value: I can link to another card link this, hi- https://trello.com/c/EyFFnJ3P/470-im-an-example-api-card

con:testSuite.name: Delete the latest Card created
con:testSuite.con:description: This TestSuite will delete the card made in the 'Another Card' Test Suite.

con:testCase.name: Delete the last Card created
con:testCase.con:description: This TestCase will Delete the last card created. This Assertion will only work once as it is checking for a HTTP 200, if ran again a HTTP 404 will returned and cause errors.
